meanings.definition: Able to be seen or noticed easily.
meanings.sent1: The bright red car was spottable from far away.
meanings.sent2: The spottable stain on the white shirt was hard to miss.
meanings.sent3: The spottable clown made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her spottable talent for singing shone brightly in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The spottable lighthouse guided ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: Capable of being identified or recognized.
meanings.sent1: The spottable logo on the package indicated its brand.
meanings.sent2: Her spottable handwriting made it easy to know who wrote the letter.
meanings.sent3: The spottable smell of cookies baking filled the house with warmth.
meanings.sent4: His spottable accent revealed his origin without a doubt.
meanings.sent5: The spottable landmark helped them find their way back to the campsite.

meanings.sent1: The spottable error in the report was quickly corrected.
meanings.sent2: The spottable tracks in the snow led them to the lost dog.
meanings.sent3: The spottable noise of the alarm woke everyone up in a panic.
meanings.sent4: Her spottable excitement about the trip was contagious to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The spottable change in his behavior raised concerns among his colleagues.
